channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Islamic Women's Council: 'The government had failed the Muslim community'
item.description: The Islamic Women's Council says the Christchurch mosque shootings might not have happened, if it weren't for the failures of multiple government agencies - particularly the security intelligence service and police.

item.title: Air NZ putting a temporary hold on new international bookings to NZ
item.description: The government and Air New Zealand have agreed to manage bookings to ensure New Zealanders arriving home can be safely placed in a managed isolation or quarantine facility.

item.title: Trending Netflix Polish film 365 Days slammed for promoting violence
item.description: Assault victims, advocates and social media users have slammed the film 365 Days, and an online petition to have it removed has amassed more than 12,000 signatures.

item.title: Auckland Transport threatens to rip out resident's berm
item.description: Rip it out - or we will. That's what Auckland Transport has told the creator of a planted berm north of Auckland.

item.title: New head scanning machine designed to reduce anxiety
item.description: Head scans in Magnetic Resonance Imaging, or MRI machines, should become more comfortable thanks to work being done by Wellington researchers.

item.title: WorkSafe inspectors 'under-resourced and inexperienced' - former Crown prosecutor
item.description: "The inadequate frequency of case reviews being undertaken by investigation managers, result in a disproportionate amount of legal time being spent remedying flawed investigations."

item.title: Critic says govt's freshwater package doesn't address the problem - pollution
item.description: The government has announced a package of 23 freshwater restoration projects across the country with more than 2000 jobs and worth $160 million.

item.title: Hospice ordered to pay redundant workers outstanding wages
item.description: An Auckland hospice has been told it was wrong to pay its workers 80 percent of their normal wage before making them redundant.

item.title: Funding provided to fix hazardous landfill
item.description: A West Coast landfill at risk of leaking asbestos and other mining waste in to the sea, has been thrown a lifeline.

item.title: NZ takes part in international survey on Covid-19
item.description: New Zealand is to take part in an international survey looking at the psychological effects of the coronavirus pandemic and how different government responses to Covid-19 have affected citizens.

item.title: Southern DHB to discuss challenges of isolation facilities in Queenstown
item.description: The Southern District Health Board is set to discuss the viability of having isolation facilities in Queenstown during a meeting this morning.

item.title: Quake felt by thousands across Christchurch
item.description: A light earthquake was felt across large parts of Christchurch this morning.

item.title: DOC defends fisher who caught protected great white shark
item.description: A fisherman has faced a barrage of criticism for causing the death of the protected species, but the Department of Conservation says he did the right thing by reporting it.

item.title: Malaysia Airlines denies New Zealand exemption visa holders from boarding
item.description: People with exemption visas to travel to New Zealand have been prevented from boarding a Malaysia Airlines flight from Cambodia after airline staff refused to accept their paperwork.

item.title: Corrections at fault over inmate's heart attack, hospital stays
item.description: The Department of Corrections failed to give a prisoner regular medication resulting in five hospitalisations, a heart attack and four stents, an inquiry has found.

item.title: Child dies in unknown circumstances in Whanganui
item.description: The child was taken to Whanganui Hospital but was unable to be revived.

item.title: Team NZ and NZME go head-to-head in court over report
item.description: A stoush over whether a report into the financial management of America's Cup should be publicised has been heard in the High Court.

item.title: Residents at Stamford Plaza Hotel seek isolation safety reassurance
item.description: Concerns are being raised that dividers installed at Auckland's Stamford Plaza Hotel are not enough to keep residents separated from people in managed isolation.
